channel.title: Changing ip help
channel.description:
before i get started, im using windows xp. i play a server where somebody hacked the owners account and iped me and a couple of other people. Does anyone know a way to change my ip so that i can access that server again? ive tried programs like sharkip but i dont think it works for servers, well atleast it didnt for me. Any help is appreciated.
thanks.

item.title: Changing ip help
item.dc:creator: @holidayscape holidayscape
item.description:
@holidayscape wrote:

ive tried turning off the router and leaving for 5 mins, and that didnt work, i will have to try it overnight tonight, i will tell you how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing ip help
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

[quote=“redrover, post:5, topic:305492”][quote author=holidayscape link=topic=401732.msg2978085#msg2978085 date=1254425543]

open up start go to run type cmd it should open up a shell.
type ipconfig/release
then go to my network connections double click it then double click ip check “use custom ip” or sometin like that type all ones and clik default gateway it should put it in automatically. save clik ok. then close it out. then open my network connections up again and clik ip again and check recieve a ip automatically save and close. vwala

saw that on youtube, followed it exactly but it still gave me the same ip
[/quote]

Maybe because you use a router…[/quote]

I don’t have a router and this doesn’t work for me either, done it plenty of times.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing ip help
item.dc:creator: @redrover redrover
item.description:
@redrover wrote:

[quote=“holidayscape, post:4, topic:305492”][quote author=bobbykinney000 link=topic=401732.msg2977321#msg2977321 date=1254361987]
open up start go to run type cmd it should open up a shell.
type ipconfig/release
then go to my network connections double click it then double click ip check “use custom ip” or sometin like that type all ones and clik default gateway it should put it in automatically. save clik ok. then close it out. then open my network connections up again and clik ip again and check recieve a ip automatically save and close. vwala
[/quote]

saw that on youtube, followed it exactly but it still gave me the same ip :([/quote]

Maybe because you use a router…

Read full topic
